        public boolean execute(java.lang.String sql)
        Executes a generic SQL Statement
        Parameters:
        sql - Statement to execute
        Returns:

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String sql)
        Executes an SQL Query and returns the ResultSet then closes it after executing Note that this method and call doesn't allow the statements Values to be retrieved nor modified after calling As its statement is closed. To modify or use Values in a ResultSet, call the executeQueryOpen method
        Parameters:
        sql - Statement to query
        Returns:
        Resultset of the pulled data, or null (if failed)

      • executeQueryOpen

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQueryOpen(java.lang.String sql)
        Executes an SQL Query and returns the ResultSet without closing it after executing; Closing is to be done in the methods using this method
        Parameters:
        sql - Statement to query
        Returns:
        Resultset of the pulled data, or null (if failed)

      • executeUpdate

        public int executeUpdate(java.lang.String sql)
        Sends an SQL Statement for execution then closes the statement afterwards
        Parameters:
        sql - Statement to execute
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing [Same as statement.executeupdates description]

      • createTable

        public boolean createTable(java.lang.String TableName,
                  java.lang.String[] Values)
        Creates a Table if it doesn't exist in the instanced database
        Parameters:
        TableName - Name of Table to create within the database
        Values - Value to put in said Table if created
        Returns:
        True if the Table was created, false otherwise

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount(java.lang.String Table)
        Gets a rowcount in the Table defined by the Table param
        Parameters:
        Table - Table to get the row-count of
        Returns:
        Count of rows in Table; 0 Means there's either 0 rows, or an error occured (Stack trace will be printed if error happens)
